com.linecorp.armeria.common

Interface TimeoutPolicy

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface TimeoutPolicy
    Determines when an invocation should time out.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <T extends TimeoutPolicy,U extends TimeoutPolicy>
      TimeoutPolicy      		 decorate(Function<T,U> decorator)
      Creates a new TimeoutPolicy decorated with the specified decorator.
      static TimeoutPolicy disabled()
      Returns a singleton instance of a TimeoutPolicy that disables timeout.
      static TimeoutPolicy ofFixed(Duration timeout)
      Creates a new TimeoutPolicy that times out an invocation after a fixed amount of time.
      long timeout(ServiceInvocationContext ctx)
      Determines the timeout of the invocation associated with the specified ServiceInvocationContext.

    • Method Detail

      • ofFixed

        static TimeoutPolicy ofFixed(Duration timeout)
        Creates a new TimeoutPolicy that times out an invocation after a fixed amount of time.
        Parameters:
        timeout - a positive value to enable timeout. zero to disable timeout.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified timeout is negative

      • disabled

        static TimeoutPolicy disabled()
        Returns a singleton instance of a TimeoutPolicy that disables timeout.

      • decorate

        default <T extends TimeoutPolicy,U extends TimeoutPolicy> TimeoutPolicy decorate(Function<T,U> decorator)
        Creates a new TimeoutPolicy decorated with the specified decorator.

      • timeout

        long timeout(ServiceInvocationContext ctx)
        Determines the timeout of the invocation associated with the specified ServiceInvocationContext.
        Returns:
        the number of milliseconds to apply timeout to the invocation. 0 to disable timeout for the invocation.
